verses.verse: The word <WH1697> of the LORD <WH3068> that came <WH1961> to Joel <WH3100> the son <WH1121> of Pethuel. <WH6602>

Hear <WH8085> this, <WH2063> you old <WH2205> men, and give ear, <WH238> all <WH3605> you inhabitants <WH3427> of the land. <WH776> Has this <WH2063> been <WH1961> in your days, <WH3117> or even <WH518> in the days <WH3117> of your fathers? <WH1>
Tell <WH5608> you your children <WH1121> of it, and let your children <WH1121> tell their children, <WH1121> and their children <WH1121> another <WH312> generation. <WH1755>

That which the palmerworm <WH1501> has left <WH3499> has the locust <WH697> eaten; <WH398> and that which the locust <WH697> has left <WH3499> has the cankerworm <WH3218> eaten; <WH398> and that which the cankerworm <WH3218> has left <WH3499> has the caterpillar <WH2625> eaten. <WH398>

Awake, <WH6974> you drunkards, <WH7910> and weep; <WH1058> and howl, <WH3213> all <WH3605> you drinkers <WH8354> of wine, <WH3196> because <WH5921> of the new wine; <WH6071> for it is cut <WH3772> off from your mouth. <WH6310>

For a nation <WH1471> is come <WH5927> up on my land, <WH776> strong, <WH6099> and without <WH369> number, <WH4557> whose teeth <WH8127> are the teeth <WH8127> of a lion, <WH738> and he has the cheek <WH4973> teeth <WH4973> of a great <WH3833> lion. <WH3833>

He has laid <WH7760> my vine <WH1612> waste, <WH8047> and barked <WH7111> my fig <WH8384> tree: he has made it clean bore, <WH2834> and cast <WH7993> it away; the branches <WH8299> thereof are made white. <WH3835>
Lament <WH421> like a virgin <WH1330> girded <WH2296> with sackcloth <WH8242> for the husband <WH1167> of her youth. <WH5271>

The meat offering <WH4503> and the drink <WH5262> offering is cut <WH3772> off from the house <WH1004> of the LORD; <WH3068> the priests, <WH3548> the LORD's <WH3068> ministers, <WH8334> mourn. <WH56>

The field <WH7704> is wasted, <WH7703> the land <WH127> mourns; <WH56> for the corn <WH1715> is wasted: <WH7703> the new <WH8492> wine <WH8492> is dried <WH3001> up, the oil <WH3323> languishes. <WH535>

Be you ashamed, <WH954> O you farmers; <WH406> howl, <WH3213> O you vinedressers, <WH3755> for the wheat <WH2406> and for the barley; <WH8184> because <WH3588> the harvest <WH7105> of the field <WH7704> is perished. <WH6>

The vine <WH1612> is dried <WH3001> up, and the fig <WH8384> tree languishes; <WH535> the pomegranate <WH7416> tree, the palm <WH8558> tree also, <WH1571> and the apple <WH8598> tree, even all <WH3605> the trees <WH6086> of the field, <WH7704> are withered: <WH3001> because <WH3588> joy <WH8342> is withered <WH3001> away from the sons <WH1121> of men. <WH120>

Gird <WH2296> yourselves, and lament, <WH5594> you priests: <WH3548> howl, <WH3213> you ministers <WH8334> of the altar: <WH4196> come, <WH935> lie <WH3885> all <WH3885> night in sackcloth, <WH8242> you ministers <WH8334> of my God: <WH430> for the meat offering <WH4503> and the drink <WH5262> offering is withheld <WH4513> from the house <WH1004> of your God. <WH430>

Sanctify <WH6942> you a fast, <WH6685> call <WH7121> a solemn <WH6116> assembly, <WH6116> gather <WH622> the elders <WH2205> and all <WH3605> the inhabitants <WH3427> of the land <WH776> into the house <WH1004> of the LORD <WH3068> your God, <WH430> and cry <WH2199> to the LORD, <WH3068>
Alas <WH162> for the day! <WH3117> for the day <WH3117> of the LORD <WH3068> is at <WH7138> hand, <WH7138> and as a destruction <WH7701> from the Almighty <WH7706> shall it come. <WH935>
Is not the meat <WH400> cut <WH3772> off before <WH5048> our eyes, <WH5869> yes, joy <WH8057> and gladness <WH1524> from the house <WH1004> of our God? <WH430>

The seed <WH6507> is rotten <WH5685> under <WH8478> their clods, <WH4053> the garners <WH214> are laid desolate, <WH8074> the barns <WH4460> are broken <WH2040> down; <WH2040> for the corn <WH1715> is withered. <WH3001>

How <WH4100> do the beasts <WH929> groan! <WH584> the herds <WH5739> of cattle <WH1241> are perplexed, <WH943> because <WH3588> they have no <WH369> pasture; <WH4829> yes, <WH1571> the flocks <WH5739> of sheep <WH6629> are made desolate. <WH816>

O LORD, <WH3068> to you will I cry: <WH7121> for the fire <WH784> has devoured <WH398> the pastures <WH4999> of the wilderness, <WH4057> and the flame <WH3852> has burned <WH3857> all <WH3605> the trees <WH6086> of the field. <WH7704>

The beasts <WH929> of the field <WH7704> cry <WH6165> also <WH1571> to you: for the rivers <WH650> of waters <WH4325> are dried <WH3001> up, and the fire <WH784> has devoured <WH398> the pastures <WH4999> of the wilderness. <WH4057>
